description: Chef Tommy Miah: He is a Bangladeshi-born British chef who is widely recognized for his contribution to the development of Indian and Bangladeshi cuisine in the UK. He has been awarded an MBE for his services to the food industry and is the author of several cookbooks.
name: Chef Tommy Miah

recipes.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger, and garlic for 2 hours. Grill chicken until browned on both sides. Saute tomato in a pan, then add grilled chicken and cook until tender.
Cook onion until browned in a pan. Add lamb and cook until browned. Add tomato, coriander, and cumin, and cook until tender.

recipes.ingredients: fish, green chili, coriander, lemon juice
recipes.instructions: Mix fish, green chili, coriander, and lemon juice in a bowl. Form the mixture into kebabs. Grill kebabs until browned on both sides.

description: Siddika Kabir: She was a Bangladeshi nutritionist, cookbook author, and television personality. She is known for her popular cookbook  which features traditional Bangladeshi recipes and cooking methods.
name: Siddika Kabir

recipes.instructions: Cook onion, ginger, and garlic in a pan until browned. Add beef and cook until browned. Add tomato and cook until tender.
Marinate mutton in yogurt, ginger, and garlic for 2 hours. Cook onion until browned in a pan. Add mutton and cook until tender.

recipes.ingredients: shrimp, coconut milk, green chili, mustard paste
recipes.instructions: Mix shrimp, coconut milk, green chili, and mustard paste in a bowl. Place the mixture in a steamer and steam for 10 minutes.

description: Chef Ahmed Hossain: He is a Bangladeshi chef who has gained popularity for his fusion of traditional Bengali and international cuisine. He has worked in various renowned restaurants in Bangladesh and is the owner of the restaurant Soi71 in Dhaka.
name: Chef Ahmed Hossain

recipes.instructions: Cook onion until browned in a pan. Add beef and cook until browned. Add potato, carrot, tomato, and water. Cover and cook until tender.
Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 2 hours. Cook onion until browned in a pan. Add chicken and cook until browned. Cook rice separately. Mix chicken and rice together.

recipes.ingredients: potato, onion, spinach, chickpea flour, spices
recipes.instructions: Mix potato, onion, and spinach in a bowl. Add chickpea flour and spices to the bowl. Form the mixture into small balls. Fry the balls in hot oil until golden brown.

description: Chef Tony Khan: He is a Bangladeshi chef who is known for his innovative approach to cooking. He is the executive chef at the Westin Dhaka hotel and has received several awards for his contribution to the food industry.
name: Chef Tony Khan

recipes.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger, garlic, and spices for 2 hours. Roast the chicken in the oven until cooked through.
Cut bread into pieces and fry in hot oil until golden brown. Heat milk, sugar, cardamom, and saffron in a pan. Add fried bread to the pan and cook until the milk is absorbed.
Cook onion, ginger, and garlic in a pan until browned. Add beef and cook until browned. Add tomato and cook until tender.

description: Chef Asad Latif: He is a Pakistani chef who has gained popularity for his cooking show Cooking with Asad. He is known for his easy-to-follow recipes and his emphasis on healthy cooking.
name: Chef Asad Latif

recipes.instructions: Cook lamb and lentils in a pot with water until tender. Grind wheat and add to the pot. Cook until the mixture is thick. Add spices and cook for another 30 minutes.

recipes.ingredients: chicken, tomatoes, onion, ginger, garlic, spices
recipes.instructions: Cook onion, ginger, and garlic in a pan until browned. Add chicken and cook until browned. Add tomatoes and spices. Cook until the chicken is tender.

recipes.ingredients: lentils, onion, tomato, ginger, garlic, spices
recipes.instructions: Cook onion, ginger, and garlic in a pan until browned. Add lentils and cook until tender. Add tomato and spices. Cook for another 10 minutes.

description: Chef Mr. Feroze Khan: He is a Bangladeshi chef who is known for his fusion of Bengali and Thai cuisine. He is the owner of the popular restaurant Thai Kitchen in Dhaka and has won several awards for his unique approach to cooking.
name: Chef Mr. Feroze Khan

recipes.instructions: Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices for 2 hours. Cook onion until browned in a pan. Add chicken and cook until browned. Cook rice separately. Mix chicken and rice together.

recipes.ingredients: beef, bone marrow, spices, wheat flour
recipes.instructions: Cook beef in a pot with water and spices until tender. Add bone marrow and wheat flour. Cook until the mixture is thick.
Boil potato and mash it. Add onion, chickpea flour, and spices to the mixture. Form the mixture into small patties. Fry the patties in hot oil until golden brown.
